intro: Scyphularia triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaved scyphularia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Scyphularia triphylla is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitats.
